name: LCD - Percutaneous Vertebral Augmentation (PVA) for Osteoporotic Vertebral Compression Fracture (VCF) (L34106)
description: This Local Coverage Determination (LCD) outlines the coverage criteria for Percutaneous Vertebral Augmentation (PVA), including Percutaneous Vertebroplasty (PVP) and Kyphoplasty (PKP), specifically for osteoporotic vertebral compression fractures (VCF).

restrictions.condition: Percutaneous Vertebral Augmentation (PVA) procedure must be one of the covered CPT codes.
Acute osteoporotic vertebral compression fracture (VCF) of less than 6 weeks duration based on symptom onset.
Subacute osteoporotic vertebral compression fracture (VCF) of 6 to 12 weeks duration based on symptom onset.
Vertebral compression fracture (VCF) located between T1 and L5.
VCF documented by advanced imaging showing bone marrow edema on MRI.
VCF documented by advanced imaging showing bone-scan/SPECT/CT uptake.
Patient is hospitalized with severe pain, indicated by a Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) pain score 8 or higher.
Patient is hospitalized with severe pain, indicated by a Visual Analog Scale (VAS) pain score 8 or higher.
Patient is non-hospitalized with moderate to severe pain, indicated by a Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) pain score 5 or higher.
Patient is non-hospitalized with moderate to severe pain, indicated by a Visual Analog Scale (VAS) pain score 5 or higher.
Optimal non-surgical management (NSM) has failed for non-hospitalized patients with moderate to severe pain.
Non-hospitalized patient with worsening pain related to VCF (one of the symptomatic options).
Non-hospitalized patient with stable to improved pain (NRS or VAS still >= 5) and progression of vertebral body height loss (one of at least two required conditions for this option).
Non-hospitalized patient with stable to improved pain (NRS or VAS still >= 5) and greater than 25% vertebral body height reduction (one of at least two required conditions for this option).
Non-hospitalized patient with stable to improved pain (NRS or VAS still >= 5) and presence of kyphotic deformity (one of at least two required conditions for this option).

Non-hospitalized patient with stable to improved pain (NRS or VAS still >= 5) and severe impact of VCF on daily functioning (Roland Morris Disability Questionnaire (RDQ) score > 17) (one of at least two required conditions for this option).
Patient with VCF should be referred for evaluation of Bone Mineral Density (BMD) for subsequent treatment as indicated.
Patient with VCF should be referred for osteoporosis education for subsequent treatment as indicated.
Patient with VCF should be instructed to take part in an osteoporosis prevention/treatment program.
Current back pain is not primarily due to the identified acute or subacute VCF(s) (absolute contraindication).
Presence of osteomyelitis (absolute contraindication).
Presence of discitis (absolute contraindication).
Presence of active systemic infection (absolute contraindication).
Presence of active surgical site infection (absolute contraindication).
Patient is pregnant (absolute contraindication).
Greater than three vertebral fractures per procedure (relative contraindication).
Allergy to bone cement (relative contraindication).
Allergy to opacification agents (relative contraindication).
Presence of uncorrected coagulopathy (relative contraindication).
Presence of spinal instability (relative contraindication).
Presence of myelopathy from the fracture (relative contraindication).
Presence of neurologic deficit (relative contraindication).
Presence of neural impingement (relative contraindication).
Presence of fracture retropulsion/canal compromise (relative contraindication).
